definition: Job (name)/Book of Job in the Old Testament
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
Book of Job (in the Old Testament)

sentences.english: Job's three friends had no more to say.
sentences.chinese: 章約伯的三位朋友無話可說。

sentences.english: But he said unto her, Thou speakest as one of the foolish women speaketh.
sentences.chinese: 約伯卻對她說，你說話像愚頑的婦人一樣。

sentences.english: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
sentences.chinese: 約伯阿，你要留心聽，要站立思想神奇妙的作爲。

sentences.english: The LORD blessed the latter part of Job's life more than the first.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，耶和華後來賜福給約伯比先前更多。

sentences.english: God knew Job would stay firm, and truly feared Him.
sentences.chinese: 上帝則堅信約伯頂得住，真心敬畏上帝。

sentences.english: Surely the latter end of Job was more blessed than the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 果然，耶和華後來賜福給約伯，比先前更多。

sentences.english: And the sons of Issachar; Tola, and Phuvah, and Job, and Shimron.
sentences.chinese: 以薩迦的兒子是陀拉，普瓦，約伯，伸侖。

sentences.english: Overall their emphasis was on the character of Job, more than anything else.
sentences.chinese: 總而言之，他們強調約伯要檢討自己，勝於其他一切。

sentences.english: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 所以約伯開口說虛妄的話，多發無知識的言語。

sentences.english: But yet the spirit of Job, was in a better tune;
sentences.chinese: 然而約伯底精神則調高一格。

sentences.english: So Job died, being old and full of days.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，約伯年紀老邁，日子滿足而死。

sentences.english: What was Job's understanding of God after all his miseries?
sentences.chinese: 約伯在這一切悲慘遭遇之後對上帝有何看法？

sentences.english: When a period of feasting had run its course, Job would send and have them purified.
sentences.chinese: 筵宴的日子過了，約伯打發人去叫他們自潔。

sentences.english: When Job fails to find consolation among the people, how does he handle his situation?
sentences.chinese: 當約伯在人間找不到安慰時，他如何自處？

sentences.english: What hope did Job still have when he could not receive comfort from his friends?
sentences.chinese: 約伯在得不到朋有的安慰時還有何盼望？

sentences.english: The Old Testament characters Job and Daniel had much in common .
sentences.chinese: 舊約人物但以理和約伯，有許多共同之處。

definition: trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
to pray on behalf of sb
